result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy James Scanlon

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Timothy James Scanlon
Current: 2000 DeKoven Ave, Racine, WI 53406 United States  (Effective: 11-01-2022)
Prior: 1125 Villa St, Racine, WI 53403

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim E.G. (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

8:55 AM Defendant Timothy James Scanlon in court, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst in court for Timothy James Scanlon.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defense indicates they would like to be heard on bond today. Seeking to modify the cash bond to a signature bond for the same amount. Makes statements on the record. Defense is also seeking a competency evaluation. 
State does not object to modifying the cash bond to modifying the bond to a signature bond. Defense does not object to comp. eval. 
BTC: Cash bond modified to a signature bond in the total amount for $2,750. Matter set over.
Competency hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Competency hearing on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
